LDAC is a codec developed bz SONY. It delivers up to 990 kbps which is the highest values of bitrate considering all 5 A2DP codecs. THe highest value of bitrate comes with sampling frequency of 96 kHz and 24 bits per sample. LDAC is used only by various SONY bluetooth audio products. aptX HD is being considered as a main competitor for LDAC. 

LDAC is a lossy codec as it uses Modified Discrete Cosine Transform. While DCT is a coding process including quantization which is executed most significantly on high-frequency data components (not high-frequency sound parts) which humans ears are suppose to be less sensible for, the 'Modification' in DCT is an addition to DCT, a process of overlapping which is suppose to save some part of data that is being lost during pure DCT. 

Apart from 990 kbps, LDAC also works with 660 kbps and 330 kbps bitrates. Device is being switched between those 3 modes depending on connection strength. The lowest mode offers poor bitrate comparable with SBC.
